brief_summary.textblock:
monitoring system and data base for long term follow up of various treatment strategies in a
      naturalistic setting of recurrent affective disorders (unipolar, bipolar) open study design,
      prospective & retrospective

clinical_study.brief_title: SPICS-BIPOLAR for Long Term Follow up

detailed_description.textblock:
all hospitalized patients of a defined mixed urban and more rural area were consecutively
      interviewed at admission and entered into the data base. at discharge they gave written
      informed consent for further tracking and interviews.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  bipolar

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  all other diagnoses

study_pop.textblock: community of wiener neustadt and neunkirchen

clinical_study.official_title: SPICS (Secure Platform for Integrating Clinical Studies) for Recurrent (Bipolar) Affective Disorders for Long Term Follow up Treatment Regiments and Outcome in a Natural Setting

oversight_info.authority: Austria: Federal Ministry for Health and Women

primary_outcome.measure: natural course of recurrent affective disorders is monitored: number of participants with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: patients from the cohort are contacted once a year (1 to 6 years)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
